articles.author: Jason Gay
articles.title: Of Pence and Peyton: The NFL Rage Continues
articles.description: Jason Gay: Vice President Mike Pence舗s walkout after a protest during the national anthem is latest chapter in a confrontational month.

articles.author: Andrew Beaton
articles.title: Vice President Mike Pence Leaves Colts Game After Anthem Protest
articles.description: Vice President Mike Pence attended and then left Sunday舗s Indianapolis Colts game in response to players protesting during the national anthem.

articles.author: Andy Pasztor
articles.title: NTSB Cites Cockpit Errors in Pence Plane Incident Last Year
articles.description: Pilot violations of several basic landing safeguards caused the chartered jet carrying then-vice presidential candidate Mike Pence to roll off the end of a wet New York runway last October.

articles.author: Andy Pasztor
articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Pence vows U.S. will return to the moon
articles.description: Laying out the most specific plans yet to promote commercial and military space projects, Vice President Mike Pence on Thursday vowed to return U.S. astronauts to the moon while studying ways to streamline federal rules controlling rocket launches.

articles.author: Andrew Ackerman
articles.title: Congress Votes to Overturn CFPB Arbitration Rule
articles.description: With Vice President Mike Pence breaking a Senate tie, Congress overturned a rule by an Obama-appointed financial regulator that would have made it easier for consumers to sue banks in groups.

articles.author: Peter Nicholas
articles.title: Warsh Met With Vice President Pence About Top Fed Job Last Week
articles.description: Kevin Warsh, a candidate for the Federal Reserve chairmanship, met with Vice President Mike Pence last week to talk about the central-bank job, according to a White House aide.

articles.author: Kate Davidson
articles.title: GOP Divided Over Monetary Policy as Fed Chief Pick Looms
articles.description: After criticizing the Fed for the past eight years, Republicans finally have a chance to change the course of the central bank when President Donald Trump nominates someone to take the helm in early 2018. But they are divided over which direction monetary pol…

articles.author: Felicia Schwartz
articles.title: Tillerson Says He 'Never Considered Leaving This Post'
articles.description: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson said Wednesday he has not contemplated resigning his job and praised President Donald Trump’s foreign policy, after a report that he called Mr. Trump a ‘moron’ and nearly quit.

articles.author: Rebecca Ballhaus
articles.title: Trump Says Tax Cuts Will Supercharge Economic Growth
articles.description: President Trump pledged that the Republican tax proposal would spur 舠the rebirth of American industry舡 and supercharge the U.S. economy amid debate over how much growth the plan will generate and its impact on the federal deficit.

articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.title: McConnell 1, Cordray 0
articles.description: The Senate GOP kills a destructive rule on legal arbitration.

articles.author: Joshua Jamerson
articles.title: The White House Sends Congress Its Immigration Wish List
articles.description: News and analysis from WSJ's Washington bureau

articles.author: Ted Mann
articles.title: Lawmakers: Trump Sours Public-Private Infrastructure Partnerships
articles.description: President Donald Trump told a bipartisan group of lawmakers Tuesday that he didn舗t favor public-private partnerships to finance public works, casting doubt on a central pillar of his administration舗s infrastructure building plans.

articles.author: Karl Rove
articles.title: Trump, Corker and the Circular Firing Squad
articles.description: Why is the president mocking a senator whose help he needs to pass tax reform?

articles.author: Peter Nicholas
articles.title: Trump Signals Yellen Still a Top Fed Candidate After Meeting This Week
articles.description: Donald Trump signaled that Fed Chairwoman Janet Yellen remains a strong candidate to be renominated for the job after the two met this week, saying he liked her “a lot,” while also highlighting John Taylor and Jerome Powell as front-runners.

articles.author: Julie Steinberg
articles.title: China-Backed Firm Reaches Deal to Buy Apple Supplier
articles.description: Canyon Bridge, whose planned acquisition of a U.S. semiconductor company was scuttled earlier this month, has reached a deal to buy chip designer Imagination Technologies for $742.2 million.

articles.author: Michelle Hackman
articles.title: Trump Signs Order Paving Way to Weaken Obama Health Law
articles.description: President Trump signed an order directing federal agencies to pursue sweeping changes to the health-care system, the administration舗s first move in what it promises will be an extended campaign to weaken the Affordable Care Act without Congress.

articles.author: Alexandra Bruell
articles.title: ESPN Suspends Jemele Hill for Tweets Aimed at Sponsors
articles.description: ESPN suspended network host Jemele Hill for violating its social media policy, after she advocated a boycott of Dallas Cowboys sponsors who are also ESPN sponsors, according to a person familiar with the situation.

articles.author: Kate Davidson
articles.title: Trump Interviews Stanford Economist John Taylor for Fed Chairman Job
articles.description: President Donald Trump interviewed Stanford University economist John Taylor on Wednesday to discuss his potential nomination to become Federal Reserve chairman, a White House official said.

articles.author: Joshua Jamerson
articles.title: Tax Debate Chugs Along — In and Outside of Washington
articles.description: News and analysis from the WSJ's Washington bureau

articles.author: Kristina Peterson
articles.title: Answering Questions on the GOP's Bid to Pass a Health Bill
articles.description: Will Senate Republicans definitely hold a vote next week? Can Democrats stall it to death? We sort though the facts, half-truths and misconceptions swirling around the Graham-Cassidy bill.
